intro: Euphrasia salisburgensis var. salisburgensis, commonly known as the Salzburg eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Alpine regions of Central Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in open meadows or alpine tundra. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in dense inflorescences. This species is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
